import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
sns.set_style('darkgrid')
source.6d4f9b75:
plt.figure(figsize = (8, 6))
plt.title('Correlation Between Gold Medals and Silver Medals', size = 13)
sns.regplot(x = df['Gold Medal'], y = df['Silver Medal'])
plt.xlabel('Gold Medals', fontsize = 12)
plt.ylabel('Silver Medals', fontsize = 12)
plt.show()
source.8943d98f:

plt.title('Correlation Between Gold Medals and Bronze Medals', size = 13)
sns.regplot(x = df['Gold Medal'], y = df['Bronze Medal'])
plt.xlabel('Gold Medals', fontsize = 12)
plt.ylabel('Bronze Medals', fontsize = 12)

source.a66165eb:

source.bad680e9:
plt.figure(figsize = (10, 8))
plt.title('Top 10 Countries That Has The Most Gold Medals in Tokyo Olympic 2020', size = 13)
bplot = sns.barplot(x = df['Gold Medal'], y = df['Country'], order = df.sort_values('Gold Medal', ascending = False)['Country'].iloc[:10])
for p in bplot.patches:
    bplot.annotate("%.0f" % p.get_width(), (p.get_width(), p.get_y() + p.get_height() / 2), (5, 0), 
                   textcoords = 'offset points', ha = 'left', va = 'center')

plt.xlabel('Gold Medals', fontsize = 12)
plt.ylabel('Country', fontsize = 12)
plt.show()

for p in bplot.patches:
    bplot.annotate("%.0f" % p.get_width(), (p.get_width(), p.get_y() + p.get_height() / 2), (5, 0),

source.3ab961bd:
plt.figure(figsize = (10, 8))
plt.title('Top 10 Countries That Has The Most Medals in Tokyo Olympic 2020', size = 13)
bplot = sns.barplot(y = df['Country'], x = df['Total'], order = df.sort_values('Total', ascending = False)['Country'].iloc[:10])
for p in bplot.patches:
    bplot.annotate("%.0f" % p.get_width(), (p.get_width(), p.get_y() + p.get_height() / 2), (5, 0), 
                   textcoords = 'offset points', ha = 'left', va = 'center')
    
plt.xlabel('Total Medals', fontsize = 12)
plt.ylabel('Country', fontsize = 12)
plt.xticks(rotation = 90)
plt.show()
source.567a61d3:
## Conclusion

The only country that has more than 100 total medals is USA which is the top one in Tokyo Olympic 2020.
source.a1a4221d:
## Conclusion

The  top 10 that has the most bronze medals are USA, ROC, Great Britain, Australia, Italy, China, Japan, Germany, Netherlands, and Ukraine.
source.586dbeb2:
## Conclusion

The correlation between each types of medals is strong and positive. We can conclude that if one of
country has lots of gold medals, it will also has lots of silver and bronze medals. If the country has lots of
silver, it will also has lots of gold and bronze medals. If the country has lots of bronze, it will also has lots of
gold and silver medals. Otherwise, if the country has a few of gold medals, it will also has a few of other
medals, etc.
source.7f2c0fe9:
## Conclusion

The  top 10 that has the most silver medals are USA, China, ROC, Great Britain, Japan,  Netherlands, France, Germany, Italy, and Spain.
source.b0b70a8e:
# Executive Summary

- Each country has different total of each types of medal. But the interesting insight is the country that has lots of gold or silver, or bronze medals, also has lots of other types of medal.

- USA, China, ROC, and Japan are one of the countries that has the most medals. However, USA is the country that has the most medals.
source.eead1d5d:
## Conclusion

The  top 10 that has the most gold medals are USA, China, Japan, Great Britain, ROC, Australia,  Netherlands, France, Germany, and Italy.
source.d56c2476:
# Problem Statement

- Is there any relationship between gold, silver, and bronze total medals?
- Who are the top 10 countries by total medals in Tokyo 2020 Olympic that has the most gold or silver or bronze medals? How many are their medals?
